result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
cab

Defendant Raymond Scott in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 16 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.  No DV surcharge was ordered.
- Pay supervision fees.

If defendant completes all the conditions earlier, the agent may ask the court to terminate his probation earlier.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Scott in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting another sentencing date in branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Scott in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case RECALLED.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Federal firearm ban to be determined at time of sentencing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Scott in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call, parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.

Defendant Raymond Scott in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to trial. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM006712  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-09-2015
Court ordered no possession of any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this case.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MM; and GM-W.

Defendant Raymond Scott in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/10/15 @ 1:30pm
